name: Painkiller
instructions:
1. Add the rum, pineapple juice, orange juice, and cream of coconut to a shaker with cubed ice and shake vigorously but briefly to combine.
2. Strain into a hurricane glass or snifter over crushed ice.
3. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and a pineapple wedge. Serve with a straw.
description: The Painkiller combines dark rum, pineapple juice, cream of coconut, and orange juice to create a refreshing drink perfect for the beach.

ingredients.name: Dark Rum
ingredients.description: Dark rum is a type of rum that is aged longer and often in charred barrels, giving it a darker color and a richer, more robust flavor compared to lighter rums. It typically has notes of caramel, molasses, and sometimes spices. Dark rum is commonly used in cocktails, especially those with a strong, flavorful profile, and it is also enjoyed neat or on the rocks. The aging process contributes to the development of complex flavors and a smoother texture.

ingredients.name: Pineapple juice
ingredients.description: Pineapple juice is extracted by passing fresh, ripe pineapple through a juice extractor (juicer) or by muddling fresh cut pineapple chunks and then straining out the solids.

ingredients.name: Cream of Coconut
ingredients.description: Coconut cream is a thick, rich, and smooth substance extracted from the flesh of mature coconuts. Coconut cream is similar to coconut milk, but it has a higher concentration of coconut solids, giving it a thicker consistency. It is often used in both savory and sweet recipes, including curries, soups, desserts, and beverages. Coconut cream is a key ingredient in many dishes in Southeast Asian, Caribbean, and other tropical cuisines.
